items.sentence: Don't throw away that magazine. I haven't read it yet.
From here to the train station is half an hour's walk.
I was kind of hoping that we wouldn't have to do this.
Mary is one of the most beautiful girls I've ever met.
Tom has been sleeping on the couch in the living room.
I suspect that Tom will do whatever you ask him to do.
Tom was going to go to the library but decided not to.
I think it's better to stay here until the snow stops.
Tom carefully stepped back from the edge of the cliff.
Bear in mind that I'm doing this for Tom, not for you.
There's no use yelling for help. Nobody will hear you.
I won't forget what you done for us as long as I live.
We all stood around the campfire, trying to stay warm.
Tom knows that Mary can't do that as well as John can.
Even though I had a head start, I still lost the race.
Summer has finally arrived in the southern hemisphere.
There's still something we have to do before we leave.
There's still something we must to do before we leave.
Tom will likely not be able to persuade Mary to drive.
Tom will be late because he's caught in a traffic jam.
